intro: Primula malvacea var. alba, commonly known as the white-flowered primrose, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and prefers well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for rock gardens and woodland settings.
